definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: Hereby I would sincerely recommend this highly-talented student to your institution.
sentences.chinese: 在此我郑重的向贵校推荐这位才华出众的学生。

sentences.english: He is a marvelously able author.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位才华出众的作家。

sentences.english: He's a remarkable writer ; he can run off a novel a week .
sentences.chinese: 他是位才华出众的作家，能在一周内赶写出一部小说。

sentences.english: In the beginning of their acquaintance he had gone even further and ascribed intellect to her;
sentences.chinese: 在他们相识之初，他甚至还认为她才华出众。

sentences.english: The talented actor seems to have been intended for the the stage from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 这位才华出众的演员似乎早就预定要活跃在舞台上。

sentences.english: As a writer of great talent he speaks with clarity and eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 作为一位才华出众的作家，他能清晰流畅地写作。

sentences.english: Talented as he is, he doesn't work hard.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他才华出众，可就是不努力学习。

definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen
well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen
